Resume one Connector to running status

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.
The resource-specific properties for this resource.

MessagingConnectorListResult.description: The response of a MessagingConnector list operation.

value.description: The MessagingConnector items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

MessagingConnectorTagsUpdate.description: The type used for updating tags in MessagingConnector resources.

certificationAuthorityCert.description: Self-signed CA, null means client certificate is signed off by public well-known CA

clientCert.description: Client certificate is signed off either by private CA (specified by certCa) or public well-known CA. If it's null, mTLS is turned off, i.e. server side shall be configured as not validate client.

tlsRevokeMode.description: Certificate revoke mode: off, CRL, OCSP, CRL+OCSP.

keyVaultUri.description: Uri for keyvault which store the Certificate.

verifyHostname.description: Whether verify the server hostname with the certificate.

Models.Connector.ConnectorProperties.description: Properties of one Azure MessagingConnector resource

maxTasks.description: Max Tasks count of the Connector.

provisioningState.description: State of provisioning of the MessagingConnector ARM Resource

Models.Connector.ConnectorProvisioningSt.description: Provisioning states of Connector ARM Resource

Models.Connector.ConnectorSubType.description: Enum of the type of Connector

Models.Connector.ConnectorType.description: Enum of the type of Connector

catalogEndpoint.description: The catalog endpoint  of auto register schema.

messageGroupId.description: The message group id of auto register schema.

schemaGroupId.description: The schema group id of auto register schema.
The schema group id in the catalog, which can be obtained from the catalog cloud provider.

schemaId.description: The schema id in schema group.

cloudEventSource.description: The source of auto register schema.

Models.Connector.SourceConnector.CloudEv.description: EventSchemaSet cloud events transform config for CDC(Change data capture).

sourceDataFormat.description: Data format of the data source

dataWithHeader.description: Whether the CSV data has a header row.

columnSeparator.description: The character used to separate columns in the CSV data.

Models.ConverterConfig.ConverterType.description: Enum of the type of Converter

values.name: ByteArrayConverter
values.description: This represents a converter for byte arrays format.

values.name: StringConverter
values.description: This represents a converter for string format.

values.name: JsonConverter
values.description: This represents a converter for json format.

values.name: AvroConverter
values.description: This represents a converter for Avro format.

values.name: CsvConverter
values.description: This represents a converter for csv format.

sourceDataFormat.description: Data format of the data source

values.name: SucceededWithSkippedDataUpLimit
values.description: Represents DataPreview Succeeded with skipped data due to up limit.

values.name: SucceededWithSkippedDataDownLimit
values.description: Represents DataPreview Succeeded with skipped data due to down limit

values.name: NoDataWithSkippedDataUpLimit
values.description: Represents DataPreview No data with skipped data due to up limit

results.description: Content of DataPreview results in Json format.

maxStartingTimeMs.description: Max starting time in Millisecond for datapreview.

maxIdleTimeMs.description: Max idle time in Millisecond for datapreview.

maxPollingTimeMs.description: Max polling time in Millisecond for datapreview.

maxDataSize.description: Max data size in Millisecond for datapreview.

accountName.description: The name of the storage account where the blob files are located

pathPattern.description: The path pattern to locate the files, default to * to poll all

discoveryDateTime.description: the datetime to start processing files, files whose creation time earlier than this will be ignored

pathDateFormat.description: Date format of {date} variable in path pattern

pathTimeFormat.description: Time format of {time} variable in path pattern, support only hours currently

outOfOrderHours.description: For how many hours late that we still consider a file to be on time

tableNames.description: AzureDataExplorer table names use commas to separate multiple tables.

connectionString.description: Gets or sets the connection string for the Azure Servicebus instance.

Models.DataSource.Confluent.ConfluentAut.description: What to do when there is no initial offset in ZooKeeper or if an offset is out of range.

values.name: Latest
values.description: Automatically reset the offset to the latest offset.

values.name: Earliest
values.description: Automatically reset the offset to the earliest offset.

Models.DataSource.Confluent.ConfluentSas.description: Enum of the SaslMechanism for Confluent connector

Models.DataSource.Confluent.ConfluentSec.description: Enum of the SecurityProtocol for Confluent connector

autoOffsetReset.description: What to do when there is no initial offset in ZooKeeper or if an offset is out of range.

Models.DataSource.CosmosDb.CosmosDbOffse.description: Enum of the OffsetPolicy for CosmosDB connector

values.name: UseLatestSourceOffset
values.description: use the latest (most recent) source offset

Models.DataSource.Dataverse.DataverseEve.description: The position of events in an Event Hub partition

values.name: Earliest
values.description: Corresponds to the first record of the partition.

values.name: Latest
values.description: Corresponds to the end of the partition.

startEventPosition.description: The position of events in an Event Hub partition.

authentication.description: Authentication for EventHub, OAuth or ConnectionString.

Models.DataSource.EventHub.EventHubEvent.description: The position of events in an Event Hub partition

values.name: Earliest
values.description: Corresponds to the first record of the partition.

values.name: Latest
values.description: Corresponds to the end of the partition.

values.name: CustomStartTime
values.description: Corresponds to the special position for one time.

startEventPosition.description: The position of events in an Event Hub partition.

authentication.description: Authentication for EventHub, OAuth or ConnectionString.

projectId.description: Google Cloud project ID where the Pub/Sub instance resides, assigned by GCP.

subscriptionName.description: Google Cloud subscription name where the Pub/Sub instance resides.

accountKey.description: Google Cloud account key, assigned by GCP.

connectionUrl.description: HANA JDBC connection URI, e.g. jdbc:sap://127.0.0.1:30015.

schema.description: HANA schema to source data from.

mode.description: The mode in which data should be fetched from SAP DB table. Default is bulk. And supported values are bulk, incrementing.

incrementingColumn.description: In order to fetch data from a SAP DB table when mode is set to incrementing, an incremental (or auto-incremental) column needs to be provided.

queryMode.description: The query mode in which data should be fetched from SAP DB table.

table.description: the SAP DB table name where the data needs to be read from.

query.description: The query statement when queryMode is set to query.

batch.description: Max rows to include in a single batch call. Should be an integer.

interval.description: The poll interval at which the data should be fetched from SAP DB table, the default value in server end is 60000 with millisecond unit.

partitions.description: The number of topic partitions that the Source connector can use to publish the data.

numericMapping.description: Whether the DECIMAL column types are mapped to the default decimal type or one of the primitive types.

Models.DataSource.Hana.HanaMode.description: Specify the mode in which data should be fetched from SAP DB table

values.name: Bulk
values.description: Bulk mode to fetch from SAP table.

values.name: Incrementing
values.description: Incrementing mode to fetch from SAP table.

Models.DataSource.Hana.HanaNumericMappin.description: Control whether the DECIMAL column types are mapped to the default decimal type or one of the primitive types.

Models.DataSource.Hana.HanaQueryMode.description: Specify the query mode in which data should be fetched from SAP DB table

values.name: Table
values.description: Query HANA by Schema and Table.

values.name: Query
values.description: Query HANA by specific SQL query.

key.description: HTTP header, request parameter, or path variable name

method.description: HTTP request method. GET or POST.

requestParameters.description: HTTP parameters to be added to request.

headers.description: HTTP headers to include in the request.

body.description: HTTP request body sent with POST request.

maxRetries.description: Maximum number of retry attempts on error before failing the task.

retryBackoffMs.description: Time to wait in ms before retrying after an error.

retriableHttpStatusCodes.description: HTTP status code or ranges to retry on. eg: 400, or 400- means code large than 400

details.description: Whether get the full details for the weather data.

language.description: The language of the weather data.

unit.description: The data unit for the weather.

Models.DataSource.MongoDb.MongoDbSnapsho.description: Specifies the criteria for performing a snapshot when the connector starts.

values.name: Initial
values.description: When the connector starts, it performs an initial database snapshot. After the snapshot completes, the connector begins to stream event records for subsequent database changes.

values.name: InitialOnly
values.description: The connector performs a database a snapshot only when no offsets have been recorded for the logical server name. After the snapshot completes, the connector stops. It does not transition to streaming event records for subsequent database changes.

values.name: NoData
values.description: The connector runs a snapshot that captures the structure of all relevant tables, but it does not create READ events to represent the data set at the point of the connectors start-up.

Models.DataSource.MongoDb.MongoDbSourceC.description: MongoDbConnector tracks a MongoDb replica set or a MongoDb shared cluster for document changes in databases and collections, recording those changes as events in Kafka topics

replicaSet.description: Name of the MongoDb replica set.

enableTls.description: Enables or disables TLS/SSL for the connection.

databaseIncludeList.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match database names to be monitored. By default, all databases are monitored.

databaseExcludeList.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match database names to be excluded from monitoring.

collectionIncludeList.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match fully-qualified namespaces for MongoDb collections to be monitored. By default, the connector monitors all collections except those in the local and admin databases.

collectionExcludeList.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match fully-qualified namespaces for MongoDb collections to be excluded from monitoring.

snapshotMode.description: Specifies the criteria for performing a snapshot when the connector starts.

snapshotFetchSize.description: Specifies the maximum number of documents that should be read in one go from each collection while taking a snapshot.

brokerUrl.description: URL of the broker where to establish the connection.

username.description: Username to use when connecting to the Mqtt v5 compliant broker.

password.description: Password to use when connecting to the Mqtt v5 compliant broker.

Models.DataSource.MySql.MySqlSnapshotMod.description: Specifies the criteria for running a snapshot when the connector starts

values.name: Initial
values.description: The connector runs a snapshot only when no offsets have been recorded for the logical server name, or if it detects that an earlier snapshot failed to complete. After the snapshot completes, the connector begins to stream event records for subsequent database changes.

values.name: InitialOnly
values.description: The connector runs a snapshot only when no offsets have been recorded for the logical server name. After the snapshot completes, the connector stops. It does not transition to streaming to read change events from the binlog.

values.name: NoData
values.description: The connector runs a snapshot that captures only the schema, but not any table data. Set this option if you do not need the topics to contain a consistent snapshot of the data, but you want to capture any schema changes that were applied after the last connector restart.

decimalHandlingMode.description: Handling mode for DECIMAL and NUMERIC.

snapshotSelectStatementOverrides.description: Select table rows to include in the snapshot.

snapshotMode.description: Specifies the criteria for running a snapshot when the connector starts.

schemaHistoryInternalSkipUnparseableDdl.description: A Boolean value that specifies whether the connector should ignore malformed or unknown database statements or stop processing so a human can fix the issue. The safe default is false. Skipping should be used only with care as it can lead to data loss or mangling when the binlog is being processed.

isStoreOnlyCapturedTablesDdl.description: A Boolean value that specifies whether the connector records schema structures from all tables in a schema or database, or only from tables that are designated for capture.

values.name: Initial
values.description: When the connector starts, it performs an initial database snapshot. After the snapshot completes, the connector begins to stream event records for subsequent database changes.

values.name: InitialOnly
values.description: The connector performs a database a snapshot only when no offsets have been recorded for the logical server name. After the snapshot completes, the connector stops. It does not transition to streaming event records for subsequent database changes.

values.name: NoData
values.description: The connector runs a snapshot that captures the structure of all relevant tables, but it does not create READ events to represent the data set at the point of the connectors start-up.

databaseUrl.description: Specifies the raw database JDBC URL. Valid values include raw TNS names and RAC connection strings.

databasePdbName.description: The name of the Oracle pluggable database that the connector captures changes from. Used in container database (CDB) installations only.

tableIncludeList.description: Tables used as source, comma-separated table name list or regular expressions

tableExcludeList.description: Tables to be excluded, comma-separated table name list or regular expressions

columnIncludeList.description: Columns to be included, comma-separated table name list or regular expressions

columnExcludeList.description: Columns to be excluded, comma-separated table name list or regular expressions

oracleDecimalHandlingMode.description: Handling mode for DECIMAL and NUMERIC.

isStoreOnlyCapturedTablesDdl.description: A Boolean value that specifies whether the connector records schema structures from all tables in a schema or database, or only from tables that are designated for capture.

Models.DataSource.PostgreSql.PostgreSqlF.description: Specifies how field names should be adjusted for compatibility with the message converter used by the connector.

values.name: Avro
values.description: Replaces the characters that cannot be used in the Avro type name with underscore.

values.name: AvroUnicode
values.description: Replaces the underscore or characters that cannot be used in the Avro type name with corresponding Unicode characters.

Models.DataSource.PostgreSql.PostgreSqlS.description: Specifies how schema names should be adjusted for compatibility with the message converter used by the connector

values.name: Avro
values.description: Replaces the characters that cannot be used in the Avro type name with underscore.

values.name: AvroUnicode
values.description: Replaces the underscore or characters that cannot be used in the Avro type name with corresponding Unicode characters.

Models.DataSource.PostgreSql.PostgreSqlS.description: Specifies the criteria for running a snapshot when the connector starts

values.name: Initial
values.description: The connector performs a snapshot only when no offsets have been recorded for the logical server name.

values.name: InitialOnly
values.description: The connector performs an initial snapshot and then stops, without processing any subsequent changes.

values.name: NoData
values.description: The connector never performs snapshots. When a connector is configured this way, after it starts.

decimalHandlingMode.description: Handling mode for DECIMAL and NUMERIC.

snapshotSelectStatementOverrides.description: Select table rows to include in the snapshot.

snapshotMode.description: Specifies the criteria for running a snapshot when the connector starts.

sslmode.description: Whether to use an encrypted connection to the PostgreSQL server

signalDataCollection.description: Fully-qualified name of the data collection that is used to send signals to the connector. Use the following format to specify the collection name:schemaName.tableName

heartbeatIntervalMs.description: Controls how frequently the connector sends heartbeat messages to a Kafka topic. The default behavior is that the connector does not send heartbeat messages.

heartbeatActionQuery.description: Specifies a query that the connector executes on the source database when the connector sends a heartbeat message.

maxBatchSize.description: Positive integer value that specifies the maximum size of each batch of events that the connector processes.

maxQueueSize.description: Positive integer value that specifies the maximum number of records that the blocking queue can hold.

pollIntervalMs.description: Positive integer value that specifies the number of milliseconds the connector should wait for new change events to appear before it starts processing a batch of events.

slotFailover.description: Specifies whether the connector creates a failover slot. If you omit this setting, or if the primary server runs PostgreSQL 16 or earlier, the connector does not create a failover slot.

schemaNameAdjustmentMode.description: Specifies how schema names should be adjusted for compatibility with the message converter used by the connector.

fieldNameAdjustmentMode.description: Specifies how field names should be adjusted for compatibility with the message converter used by the connector.

timePrecisionMode.description: Time, date, and timestamps can be represented with different kinds of precision.

Models.DataSource.PostgreSql.PostgreSqlS.description: Specifies the criteria for running a snapshot when the connector starts

values.name: Allow
values.description: Allow attempts to use an unencrypted connection first and, failing that, a secure (encrypted) connection.

values.name: Prefer
values.description: Prefer attempts to use a secure (encrypted) connection first and, failing that, an unencrypted connection.

values.name: Require
values.description: Require uses a secure (encrypted) connection, and fails if one cannot be established.

values.name: VerifyCa
values.description: Verify-ca behaves like require but also verifies the server TLS certificate against the configured Certificate Authority (CA) certificates, or fails if no valid matching CA certificates are found.

values.name: VerifyFull
values.description: Verify-full behaves like verify-ca but also verifies that the server certificate matches the host to which the connector is trying to connect.

Models.DataSource.PostgreSql.PostgreSqlT.description: Controls whether a tombstone event should be generated after a delete event

values.name: Adaptive
values.description: Captures the time and timestamp values exactly as in the database using either millisecond, microsecond, or nanosecond precision values based on the database columns type.

values.name: AdaptiveTimeMicroseconds
values.description: Captures the date, datetime and timestamp values exactly as in the database using either millisecond, microsecond, or nanosecond precision values based on the database columns type. An exception is TIME type fields, which are always captured as microseconds.

values.name: Connect
values.description: Always represents time and timestamp values by using Kafka Connects built-in representations for Time, Date, and Timestamp, which use millisecond precision regardless of the database columns' precision.

connectionUri.description: Solace Pubsub+ connection URI, e.g. tcp://127.0.0.1:55555.

userName.description: Solace Pubsub+ connection username. Note: Currently we support only username/password. expose TLS related, properties is we want to support client certificate authentication

solaceTopics.description: Comma separated list of PubSub+ topics to subscribe to.

solaceQueue.description: PubSub+ queue name to consume from, must exist on event broker.

messageProcessor.description: PubSub+ Kafka Source connector message processor. PubSub+ Kafka Source connector message processor Refer to https://github.com/SolaceProducts/pubsubplus-connector-kafka-source

mapUserProperties.description: If enabled, maps/forwards the user properties Map from Solace message to Kafka record headers.

mapSolaceProperties.description: If enabled, maps/forwards the Solace message standard properties (e.g. correlationId, applicationMessageId, redelivered, dmqEligible, COS etc) to Kafka record headers

kafkaMessageKey.description: When using SolaceSampleKeyedMessageProcessor, defines which part of a PubSub+ message shall be converted to a Kafka record key

Models.DataSource.SqlServer.SqlServerSna.description: Specifies the criteria for running a snapshot when the connector starts

values.name: Initial
values.description: The connector performs a database snapshot as described in the default workflow for creating an initial snapshot. After the snapshot completes, the connector begins to stream event records for subsequent database changes.

values.name: InitialOnly
values.description: The connector performs a database snapshot and stops before streaming any change event records, not allowing any subsequent change events to be captured.

values.name: NoData
values.description: The connector captures the structure of all relevant tables, performing all the steps described in the default snapshot workflow, except that it does not create READ events to represent the data set at the point of the connectors start-up (Step 7.b).

decimalHandlingMode.description: Handling mode for DECIMAL and NUMERIC.

snapshotSelectStatementOverrides.description: Select table rows to include in the snapshot.

snapshotMode.description: Specifies the criteria for running a snapshot when the connector starts.

isStoreOnlyCapturedTablesDdl.description: A Boolean value that specifies whether the connector records schema structures from all tables in a schema or database, or only from tables that are designated for capture.

isDeltaFlowEnabled.description: A Boolean value that specifies whether the connector enable delta flow.

values.name: Cdc
values.description: change data capture(CDC) Schema Properties Types

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.
The resource-specific properties for this resource.
